title:
Will Alphabet Inc Class A (GOOGL) Stay at the Top of the Communication 
Services Sector?
text:
The 96 rating InvestorsObserver gives to Alphabet Inc Class A (GOOGL)  stock puts it near the top of the Communication Services sector.

In addition to scoring higher than 99 percent of stocks in the Communication Services sector, GOOGL’s 96 overall rating means the stock scores better than 96 of all stocks.





 GOOGL has an Overall Score of 96. Find out what this means to you and get the rest of the rankings on GOOGL!
See Full GOOGL Report


What do These Ratings Mean?

Trying to find the best stocks can be a daunting task. There are a wide variety of ways to analyze stocks in order to determine which ones are performing the strongest. *Investors Observer* makes the entire process easier by using percentile rankings that allows you to easily find the stocks who have the strongest evaluations by analysts.

This ranking system incorporates numerous factors used by analysts to compare stocks in greater detail. This allows you to find the best stocks available in the communication services sector with relative ease.

These percentile-ranked scores using both fundamental and technical analysis give investors an easy way to view the attractiveness of specific stocks. Stocks with the highest scores have the best evaluations by analysts working on Wall Street.



What's Happening With Alphabet Inc Class A Stock Today?

Alphabet Inc Class A (GOOGL) stock is down -0.41% while the S&P 500 is higher by 0.15% as of 11:06 AM on Monday, Feb 12. GOOGL has fallen -$0.61 from the previous closing price of $149.00 on volume of 5,641,704 shares. Over the past year the S&P 500 has risen 21.68% while GOOGL is higher by 56.84%. GOOGL earned $5.43 a per share in the over the last 12 months, giving it a price-to-earnings ratio of 27.34.
